result.execSummary:
The defendant Daydreana D Walls Willis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days. Court authorized payment plan.
With Huber and good time. Stayed for 160 hours of community service.
DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample. Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Daydreana D Walls Willis in court.  Attorney Michael J. Short in court for Daydreana D Walls Willis.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1. Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. Two victims make statements. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count #2 and 3.

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1     
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 20 days in the DCJ, with Huber and good time

-Stayed for 160 hours of community service

-Provide DNA sample on December 14th, 2022 at 9:00 am

-Restitution:$711.00 (State has   days to prepare an order)

-Court finds DE eligible for expunction under 973.015

-Days credit for time served: Zero days

for 6/22 status conference only

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant appeared.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE has not retained an atty as of yet. DE has been denied by SPD, and has not completed CDP application. DE wants a private atty, however has not retained one. If the DE does not have an attorney by the next hearing date DE requests to speak to the ADA without counsel. State advises the DE has advised she wants an attorney for this case and request a waiver of attorney for this hearing only. DE completed the waiver of atty FOR THIS HEARING ONLY. DE answered questions of the court and determines the DE is competent to waive her right to counsel for this hearing ONLY.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant here today at Collections window to apply for county appointed attorney - to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.
DE was not approved by SPD. Court issued new notice for status conference.

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:36 AM Defendant appeared.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
